DOC.criteria: Clinical diagnosis acute ischemic stroke Provided Informed Consent Male female Aged 20 85 year inclusive Treatment within 39 hr onset stroke symptom . NIHSS score 424 inclusive clinical sign hemispheric infarction Must receive IMP within 60 minute brain image Cerebral artery occlusion highgrade stenosis MCA Prestroke mRS score > 1 Previously expose desmoteplase Scores > 2 NIHSS question 1a indicating coma History clinical presentation ICH , subarachnoid haemorrhage ( SAH ) , arteriovenous malformation ( AVM ) , moyamoya disease , cerebral neoplasm aneurysm Current use oral anticoagulant prolong prothrombin time ( INR > 1.6 ) Treated heparin previous 48 hour prolong partial thromboplastin time Baseline platelet count < 100,000/mm3 Baseline haematocrit < 0.25 Baseline blood glucose < 50 mg/dl > 200 mg/dl Uncontrolled hypertension define blood pressure , systolic > 185 mmHg diastolic > 110 mmHg least 2 separate occasion least 10 minute apart Patient hereditary acquire hemorrhagic diathesis Gastrointestinal urinary bleeding within past 21 day Arterial puncture noncompressible site within previous 7 day Another stroke serious head injury past 6 week Major surgery serious injury , include site head , within precede 14 day Seizure onset stroke Acute myocardial infarction ( AMI ) within previous 3 week Thrombolytic within previous 72 hr Pregnant Other inclusion exclusion criterion may apply .
